name: The Eleventh Hour
description: You have discovered Mirror Hoshi Sato--formerly Empress Sato--has set her sights on ruling not just the Terran Empire, but the entire universe... once she uses temporal degeneration to destroy her foes. Can you find a way to stop her?
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Adira, Zareh, Sato, Mirror Universe Crew, Courier Burnham, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the ISS Discovery, ISS Avenger and Miranda Class will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Adira, Zareh, Sato, Mirror Universe, or Courier Burnham

featured_crew.name: Picard
featured_crew.flavor: Stepping in for the missing Jonathan Archer, Picard helped form the Coalition of Planets. (Second Battle of New York player vote winner!)

featured_crew.name: Zareh
featured_crew.flavor: A courier in the 32nd Century, Zareh cruelly exploited The Colony as its only mercantile connection to the galaxy.

action.name: All That Matters Now Is Dilithium

featured_crew.name: Sato
featured_crew.flavor: After taking over the Defiant in the mirror universe, Sato proclaimed herself Empress of the Terran Empire.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Sato
rewards.flavor: Comm Officer onboard the Enterprise, Hoshi Sato's experiences led her to create a universal linguacode.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Credits
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

screens.text: "Why, Captain, I resent these accusations. I had my chance to rule the Terran Empire. Time robbed me of it, and I suppose it would only be fair of time to give it back... but how could I control such a thing?"

"I couldn't! So all we can do is play the hand we've been dealt. If prime individuals should find themselves in my universe, and die there... and my rival Terrans die here... well, that's just my good luck, isn't it? Plus a little Orion ingenuity."

"Captain, I don't have much time. I managed to get access to a comm... don't get distracted by Sato. She wants you to come after her and Zareh. You have to find a solution for temporal degeneration. That'll leave her toothless."

"Burnham told me about an encounter she and Mirror Georgiou had on Dannus V. It sounded crazy, but... I know from crazy. I think this is a real shot, if we can find him. We'll need to get past this ugly version of the Discovery first...."
"I've found him. Carl. The... Guardian of Forever. I asked him what that even was, and he said exactly what it sounds like. He makes sure there IS a forever... wild stuff."

responses.text: "What if we thought on a smaller scale? One person at a time?"
"Adira, this was your idea. What were you hoping to achieve?"
"Carl?! Of all the names... that was his pick?"

screens.text: "But even Carl can't solve this one. He told me that if he could have sent everyone back where they belonged, ended this crisis for us, he would have. He's a guardian, not a god."
"Sounds like you've debriefed Kirk, McCoy, and Spock, too. Crazy, talking to these people that used to be as historical to me as... I don't know, Moses."
"He chose it. Must mean that it's right for him, no matter what we think."

"We can science our way out of this. Temporal degeneration is a mismatch between a person's molecules and the molecules around them, right? Maybe Carl can help us retrofit people, somehow? Like you would an old ship?"
"I'll take it to him--if you can clear me a path through Empress Sato and Zareh's orbital bombardment."
